extended_metaphor.metaphor: both Moons in the solar system and Repulsor technology in Iron Man have stabilization as a key design principle
extended_metaphor.moons: Moons provide gravitational balance to the planets they orbit, stabilizing their orbits and maintaining the overall balance of the planetary system.
extended_metaphor.repulsor_technology: Similarly, Repulsor technology in Iron Man stabilizes his flight and combat maneuvers by providing balance and control, allowing him to move swiftly and efficiently.

extended_metaphor.metaphor: both Moons in the solar system and Repulsor technology in Iron Man rely on orbital mechanics for functionality
extended_metaphor.moons: Moons continuously revolve around their host planet in specific orbits, following the laws of orbital mechanics and contributing to the celestial dance of the solar system.
extended_metaphor.repulsor_technology: Likewise, Repulsor technology in Iron Man enables him to maneuver with precision and agility by adjusting the direction and intensity of the repulsor beams, allowing him to navigate through complex environments.

extended_metaphor.metaphor: both Moons in the solar system and Repulsor technology in Iron Man maintain equilibrium through gravitational forces
extended_metaphor.moons: Moons maintain equilibrium through gravitational forces, interacting with their host planet and other celestial bodies in a system of interlocking cycles reminiscent of gears in machinery.
extended_metaphor.repulsor_technology: Similarly, Repulsor technology in Iron Man utilizes gravitational forces to stabilize his movements and enhance his combat capabilities, creating a seamless and efficient system of interlocking cycles that mimic the celestial harmony observed in the solar system.
